Balance

The balance of True Creation as an a-temporal moment is such that it is both the origin and outcome of the temporal existence of all its temporal Creations. Therefore, the combined output quantity and Soul Enrichment of all Creations must equal its input. The balance, or moment, may therefore be thought of as a statement or a compromise of the competing wills of all atman.

If such a balance may be achieved through any combination of Soul Enrichment, soul_fusion, soul_fission, and Soul Destruction, this would discount Stagnation Theory.

Roles of Atman

Each caste and category of atman takes on a roll in the balance of True Creation which affects their experience within Creation.

Divine

Gods

Divine atman are typically the primary sculptors of a Creation, having enough mana at their disposal to render that wielded by lesser atman insignificant. Those which take an active role in the sculpture of a Creation may be named Gods.

Soul Stewards

Soul Stewards dedicate themselves to the conservation and enrichment of all atman. Typically they individually wield less mana than Gods, and so they work in concert from the Great Beyond to ensure that the form of a Creation will not harm resident atman. Due to the lack of precision in Creation, however, Soul Stewards often enter in to Creations to more closely guard atman - though they are then bound by the Internal Mechanisms largely under the control of Gods. They may also be brought into a Creation against their will by a strong enough God.

Usually, the Soul Stewards manage to ensure that there is some mechanism by which a Creations lifespan can be cut short from the inside, should it appear to be too hazardous, but this is not always possible.

Mortal

Mortal Atman generally wield too little excess mana to have any significant influence on the form, Internal Mechanisms, and Predestined Events of a Creation. Furthermore, they are often bound to a Creation at the whim of a God, rather than by their own volition, and once there may be swept about and bound to vessels at the pleasure of Gods and Soul Stewards.

Hunger

Hunger are a destructive force which typically has no interest in taking part in Creations, and so the strongest are rarely bound to them. Weaker Hunger sometimes enter into Creations by the will of Gods, but the Soul Stewards always strive to prevent this.
